psm-IA-1.1.category: IA 1.  IA Component Name:  Conceptual Data Model (CDM)
psm-IA-1.1.description: The PSM shall demonstrate adoption of a CDM that depicts the business area high-level data and general relationships for intrastate exchange.

psm-IA-1.2.category: IA 1.  IA Component Name:  Conceptual Data Model (CDM)
psm-IA-1.2.description: The PSM shall identify relationships between the PSM and other key entities in the Medicaid enterprise.

psm-IA-2.1.category: IA 2.  IA Component Name:  Data Management Strategy (DMS)
psm-IA-2.1.description: The PSM shall demonstrate the adoption of an intrastate metadata repository and contribute to the agency definition of the data entities, attributes, data models, and relationships sufficiently to convey the overall meaning and use of Medicaid data and information.

psm-IA-2.2.category: IA 2.  IA Component Name:  Data Management Strategy (DMS)
psm-IA-2.2.description: The PSM shall update all historical claim data, recipient enrollment, provider enrollment, and other primary reference data on a scheduled basis.

psm-IA-3.1.category: IA 3.  IA Component Name:  Data Standards (DS)
psm-IA-3.1.description: The PSM shall, at a minimum, support transfer of provider screening data to and from MMIS and other entities.

psm-IA-3.2.category: IA 3.  IA Component Name:  Data Standards (DS)
psm-IA-3.2.description: The PSM shall support consumption of data in multiple formats from many sources, such as vital statistics, MCO encounter data, benefit manager encounter data (pharmacy, dental, mental health), waiver program data, and census bureau.
psm-IA-3.2.comment: Evidence: demonstrated by interfacing with LEIE data

psm-IA-3.3.category: IA 3.  IA Component Name:  Data Standards (DS)
psm-IA-3.3.description: The PSM shall require, capture, and maintain the 10-digit national provider identifier.

psm-IA-3.4.category: IA 3.  IA Component Name:  Data Standards (DS)
psm-IA-3.4.description: The PSM shall accept the national provider identifier in all standard electronic transactions mandated under HIPAA.

psm-IA-3.5.category: IA 3.  IA Component Name:  Data Standards (DS)
psm-IA-3.5.description: The PSM shall interface with the National Plan and Provider Enumerator System (NPPES) to verify the NPI of provider applicants.

psm-IA-3.6.category: IA 3.  IA Component Name:  Data Standards (DS)
psm-IA-3.6.description: The PSM shall not allow atypical providers to be assigned numbers that duplicate any number assigned by the NPPES.

psm-IA-3.7.category: IA 3.  IA Component Name:  Data Standards (DS)
psm-IA-3.7.description: The PSM shall provide the ability to link and de-link to other Medicaid provider IDs for the same provider, (e.g., numbers used before the NPI was established, erroneously issued prior numbers, multiple NPIs for different subparts, etc.). Captures/crosswalks subpart NPIs used by Medicare (but not Medicaid) to facilitate coordination of benefits (COB) claims processing.

psm-IA-3.8.category: IA 3.  IA Component Name:  Data Standards (DS)
psm-IA-3.8.description: The PSM shall be capable of or support the production of a random sample of data that would be needed for audit purposes based on the state-established selection criteria.

psm-IA-3.9.category: IA 3.  IA Component Name:  Data Standards (DS)
psm-IA-3.9.description: The PSM shall comply with the SMA's standardized structure and vocabulary data for automated electronic intrastate interchanges and interoperability.

psm-IA-4.1.category: IA 4.  IA Component Name:  Logical Data Model (LDM)
psm-IA-4.1.description: The PSM shall support a  Logical Data Model (LDM) in the  identification of data classes, attributes, relationships, standards, and code sets for intrastate exchange.

psm-IA-4.2.category: IA 4.  IA Component Name:  Logical Data Model (LDM)
psm-IA-4.2.description: The PSM shall maintain providers' data (e.g., links from providers to other entities, such as groups, managed care organizations, chains, networks, ownerships, and partnerships).

psm-IA-4.3.category: IA 4.  IA Component Name:  Logical Data Model (LDM)
psm-IA-4.3.description: The PSM shall verify that all fields defined as numeric contain only numeric data.

psm-IA-4.4.category: IA 4.  IA Component Name:  Logical Data Model (LDM)
psm-IA-4.4.description: The PSM shall verify that all fields defined as alphabetic contain only alphabetic data.

psm-IU-1.1.category: IU 1.  Technical Service Classification:  Configuration Management
psm-IU-1.1.description: The PSM shall use technology-neutral interfaces that localize and minimize impact of new technology insertion.

psm-IU-2.1.category: IU 2.  Technical Service Classification:  Data Access and Management
psm-IU-2.1.description: The PSM shall maintain online access to at least four years of selected management reports and five years of annual reports.
psm-IU-2.1.comment: Currently there is no reporting planned for PSM.  However, there is no plan to delete the data in the database.

psm-IU-2.2.category: IU 2.  Technical Service Classification:  Data Access and Management
psm-IU-2.2.description: The PSM shall conduct information exchange (internally and externally) using MITA Framework, industry standards, and other nationally recognized standards.

psm-IU-2.3.category: IU 2.  Technical Service Classification:  Data Access and Management
psm-IU-2.3.description: The PSM shall develop data models that include mapping of information exchange with external organizations.

psm-IU-2.4.category: IU 2.  Technical Service Classification:  Data Access and Management
psm-IU-2.4.description: The PSM shall apply single source of information methodologies.

psm-IU-2.5.category: IU 2.  Technical Service Classification:  Data Access and Management
psm-IU-2.5.description: The PSM shall provide full-text search capability
psm-IU-2.5.comment: This is requested by Anshuman during the 8/10/17 PSM status meeting

psm-IU-3.1.category: IU 3.  Technical Service Classification:  Decision Management
psm-IU-3.1.description: The PSM of shall use standardized business rules definitions that reside in a separate application or rules engine.

psm-IU-3.2.category: IU 3.  Technical Service Classification:  Decision Management
psm-IU-3.2.description: The PSM shall use rules editor that maintains the current version of standardized business rules definitions in a language that business people can interpret and transforms them into machine language to automate them.

psm-IU-4.1.description: The PSM shall support an authorized user access to user activity history and other management functions, including log-on approvals/ disapprovals and log search and playback.

psm-IU-4.2.description: The PSM shall define information sharing and event notification standards to allow aggregated and integrated information.

psm-IU-4.3.description: The PSM shall provide an architecture diagram depicting how it is technically structured.
psm-IU-4.3.comment: This is requested by Anshuman during the 8/10/17 PSM status meeting

psm-AD-1.1.category: AD 1.  Technical Service Classification:  Business Intelligence
psm-AD-1.1.description: The PSM shall support a range of analysis actions.

psm-AD-1.2.category: AD 1.  Technical Service Classification:  Business Intelligence
psm-AD-1.2.description: The PSM shall collect and summarize data for specific user communities (e.g. data marts or cubes) such as program analysis staff, research group, financial management unit, agency executives (e.g. dashboard).

psm-AD-1.3.category: AD 1.  Technical Service Classification:  Business Intelligence
psm-AD-1.3.description: The PSM shall provide reports that allow users to drill down from summarized data to detailed data.

psm-AD-1.4.category: AD 1.  Technical Service Classification:  Business Intelligence
psm-AD-1.4.description: The PSM shall limit access to authorized group of stakeholders.

psm-AD-2.1.category: AD 2.  Technical Service Classification:  Client Support
psm-AD-2.1.description: The PSM shall provide a user interface or associated interfaces text titles for frames to facilitate frame identification and navigation.

psm-AD-2.2.category: AD 2.  Technical Service Classification:  Client Support
psm-AD-2.2.description: The PSM shall provide member and provider access to services via browser, kiosk, voice response solution, or mobile device, and manual submissions.

psm-AD-2.3.category: AD 2.  Technical Service Classification:  Client Support
psm-AD-2.3.description: The PSM shall conform to usability and design standards set by the state. This includes aesthetics, consistency in the user interface, and visual quality of the interfaces.

psm-AD-2.4.category: AD 2.  Technical Service Classification:  Client Support
psm-AD-2.4.description: The PSM shall fully comply with section 508 accessibility.

psm-AD-2.5.category: AD 2.  Technical Service Classification:  Client Support
psm-AD-2.5.description: To the greatest extent possible, the PSM shall be browser agnostic.

psm-AD-3.1.category: AD 3.  Technical Service Classification:  Forms and Reporting
psm-AD-3.1.description: The PSM shall support retrieval and presentation of data associated with geographic indicators such as state, county, and zip code.

psm-AD-3.2.category: AD 3.  Technical Service Classification:  Forms and Reporting
psm-AD-3.2.description: The PSM shall support federal reporting requirements when these requirements are met through the decision support services (DSS).

psm-AD-3.3.category: AD 3.  Technical Service Classification:  Forms and Reporting
psm-AD-3.3.description: The PSM shall support a variety of formats and output options (e.g. Word, Excel, html, Access database, or GUI formats).

psm-AD-3.4.category: AD 3.  Technical Service Classification:  Forms and Reporting
psm-AD-3.4.description: The PSM shall support simple queries and pre-formatted reports that are easy to access, follow a user-friendly protocol, and produce responses immediately.

psm-AD-3.5.category: AD 3.  Technical Service Classification:  Forms and Reporting
psm-AD-3.5.description: The PSM shall provide ad hoc reporting capability that presents summarized information on key factors to executive staff upon request.

psm-AD-3.6.category: AD 3.  Technical Service Classification:  Forms and Reporting
psm-AD-3.6.description: The PSM shall provide ad hoc query capability for retrieval of data relevant to specific operational units.

psm-AD-4.1.category: AD 4.  Technical Service Classification:  Performance Measurement
psm-AD-4.1.description: The PSM shall provide the ability to record and monitor the performance and utilization of resources within the overall system.

psm-AD-4.2.category: AD 4.  Technical Service Classification:  Performance Measurement
psm-AD-4.2.description: The PSM shall generate performance measures for specific business processes using predefined and ad hoc reporting methods.

psm-AD-5.1.category: AD 5.  Technical Service Classification:  Security and Privacy

psm-AD-5.2.category: AD 5.  Technical Service Classification:  Security and Privacy
psm-AD-5.2.description:
The PSM shall verify the identity of all users, denies access to invalid users. For example:
•  Requires unique sign-on (ID and password)
•  Requires authentication of the receiving entity prior to a system initiated session, such as transmitting responses to eligibility inquiries.

psm-AD-5.3.category: AD 5.  Technical Service Classification:  Security and Privacy
psm-AD-5.3.description: The PSM shall enforce password policies for length, character requirements, and updates.

psm-AD-5.4.category: AD 5.  Technical Service Classification:  Security and Privacy
psm-AD-5.4.description: The PSM shall support a user security profile that controls user access rights to data categories and system functions.

psm-AD-5.5.category: AD 5.  Technical Service Classification:  Security and Privacy
psm-AD-5.5.description: The PSM shall permit supervisors or other designated officials to set and modify user security access profile.

psm-AD-5.6.category: AD 5.  Technical Service Classification:  Security and Privacy
psm-AD-5.6.description: The PSM shall alert appropriate staff authorities of potential violations of privacy safeguards, such as inappropriate access to confidential information.

psm-AD-5.7.category: AD 5.  Technical Service Classification:  Security and Privacy
psm-AD-5.7.description: The PSM of shall contain verification mechanisms that are capable of authenticating authority (as well as identify) for the use or disclosure requested.

psm-AD-5.8.category: AD 5.  Technical Service Classification:  Security and Privacy
psm-AD-5.8.description: The PSM shall provide the capability that all system activity can be traced to a specific user or entity.

psm-AD-5.9.category: AD 5.  Technical Service Classification:  Security and Privacy
psm-AD-5.9.description: The PSM shall log system activity and enable analysts to examine system activity in accordance with audit policies and procedures (error diagnosis, and performance management) adopted by the Medicaid agency.

psm-AD-5.10.category: AD 5.  Technical Service Classification:  Security and Privacy
psm-AD-5.10.description: The PSM shall have the capability to provision access to an authorized user or request.

psm-AD-5.11.category: AD 5.  Technical Service Classification:  Security and Privacy
psm-AD-5.11.description:
The PSM shall  have standard Access Control specifications to include:
(i) Assigning a unique name and/or number for identifying and tracking user identity. (Required)
(iii) Implementing electronic procedures that terminate an electronic session after a predetermined time of inactivity. (Addressable)

psm-AD-5.12.category: AD 5.  Technical Service Classification:  Security and Privacy
psm-AD-5.12.description: The PSM shall support roles and responsibilities of individuals that are separated through assigned information access authorization as necessary to prevent malevolent activity.

psm-AD-5.13.category: AD 5.  Technical Service Classification:  Security and Privacy
psm-AD-5.13.description: User account access authorization should follow the concept of least privilege; allowing users access to only the information that is necessary to accomplish assigned tasks in accordance with business functions.

psm-AD-5.14.category: AD 5.  Technical Service Classification:  Security and Privacy
psm-AD-5.14.description: The PSM shall support the state policy to disable account due to invalid login attempts.

psm-AD-5.15.category: AD 5.  Technical Service Classification:  Security and Privacy
psm-AD-5.15.description: After 15 minutes of inactivity, the PSM shall initiate a session lock; the session lock should remain in place until the user reestablishes access using established identification and authentication procedures.

psm-AD-5.16.category: AD 5.  Technical Service Classification:  Security and Privacy
psm-AD-5.16.description: The PSM shall enforce a sufficient level of authentication / identification against fraudulent transmission and imitative communications deceptions by validating the transmission, message, station or individual.

psm-AD-5.17.category: AD 5.  Technical Service Classification:  Security and Privacy
psm-AD-5.17.description: The PSM shall use only FIPS Pub 140-2-approved (or higher) encryption algorithms.

psm-AD-5.18.category: AD 5.  Technical Service Classification:  Security and Privacy
psm-AD-5.18.description: The PSM shall be secure from unauthorized access or use, and shall sanitize inputs and outputs where possible so as to avoid compromising itself or other systems.

psm-SQ-1.1.description: The PSM shall have an open source repository and source code base organized to be welcoming to outside contributors.

psm-SQ-1.2.description: The PSM shall include and undergo automated testing at regular intervals, through continuous integration and deployment processes.  The PSM shall also undergo manual testing and QA as needed.

psm-SQ-1.3.description: The PSM shall use modern source code dependency management techniques, and shall use up-to-date versions of upstream third-party dependencies and formats.

psm-SQ-1.4.description: The PSM shall use documented build, test, release, and installation processes that are automated as much as possible, for both development and production use.

psm-SQ-1.5.description: The PSM shall use D.R.Y. coding principles to avoid unnecessary complexity, inflexibility, redundancy, and denormalization in the source code and database schemas, and to use precise terminology in data structures and operations.

psm-SQ-1.6.description: The PSM shall use system resources efficiently and in proportion to operational demands and data size.

psm-II-1.1.category: II 1.  Technical Service Classification:  Business Process Management
psm-II-1.1.description: The PSM shall use a mix of manual and automated business processes.

psm-II-2.1.category: II 2.  Technical Service Classification:  Data Connectivity
psm-II-2.1.description: The PSM shall perform advanced information monitoring and routes system alerts and alarms to communities of interest when the system detects unusual conditions.
psm-II-2.1.comment: Log file and screen alert to the operator (e.g. lost connectivity to external system/database)

psm-II-2.2.category: II 2.  Technical Service Classification:  Data Connectivity
psm-II-2.2.description: The PSM shall use a standards for message format to ensure interoperability (e.g. XML JSON)

psm-II-2.3.category: II 2.  Technical Service Classification:  Data Connectivity
psm-II-2.3.description:
Transport interoperability - 
The PSM shall comply with standard data transfer protocols as applicable to health IT systems, their constituent elements/modules, and services

psm-II-2.4.category: II 2.  Technical Service Classification:  Data Connectivity
psm-II-2.4.description:
Syntactic interoperability - 
The PSM shall comply with national standards for data message formatting, as applicable to health IT systems, their constituent elements/modules, and services

psm-II-2.5.category: II 2.  Technical Service Classification:  Data Connectivity
psm-II-2.5.description:
Semantic interoperability - 
The PSM shall use standardized code sets to enable the processing and interpretation of received data as applicable to health IT systems.
psm-II-2.5.comment: Evidence: PSM is currently using NPI as a standardized code set demonstration, allowing loading of the provider type code

psm-II-3.1.category: II 3.  Technical Service Classification:  Service Oriented Architecture
psm-II-3.1.description: The PSM shall adopt MITA-recommended ESB, automated arrangement, coordination, and management of system.

psm-II-3.2.category: II 3.  Technical Service Classification:  Service Oriented Architecture
psm-II-3.2.description: The PSM shall conduct reliable messaging, including guaranteed message delivery (without duplicates) and support for non-deliverable messages.

psm-II-4.1.category: II 4.  Technical Service Classification:  System Extensibility
psm-II-4.1.description: The PSM shall use RESTful and/or SOAP-based web services for seamless coordination and integration with other U.S. Department of Health & Human Services (HHS) applications and intrastate agencies.

psm-II-4.2.category: II 4.  Technical Service Classification:  System Extensibility
psm-II-4.2.description: The PSM shall document all interfaces in an Interface Control Document (ICD), along with how those interfaces are maintained.

psm-II-4.3.category: II 4.  Technical Service Classification:  System Extensibility
psm-II-4.3.description:
Loosely coupled APIs - 
The PSM module dependencies shall be minimized to the greatest extent possible.

psm-II-4.4.category: II 4.  Technical Service Classification:  System Extensibility
psm-II-4.4.description:
Clearly documented - 
The PSM shall provide detailed API documentation provided for every API.

psm-II-4.5.category: II 4.  Technical Service Classification:  System Extensibility
psm-II-4.5.description: The PSM shall be configurable where feasible.

psm-FR-1.1.category: FR 1.  Capability to conduct identity verification
psm-FR-1.1.description: The PSM shall accept a form that shows a tax ID number and legal name for each provider (ex forms: CP 575 or 147C letter; 941 Employers' Quarterly Federal Tax Return; 8109 Tax Coupon; or letter from IRS with the Federal Tax Identification Number and legal name).
psm-FR-1.1.source_doc: MISSOURI MEDICAID PROVIDER ENROLLMENT INFORMATION GUIDE.docx
psm-FR-1.1.comment: Does this include how the provider is legally organized and structured?   Does this include info regarding whether the provider is private vs non-profit, a public entity, state government agency?  Yes. data field entity type under ownership tab, user can specify all these provider business types.

psm-FR-1.2.category: FR 1.  Capability to conduct identity verification
psm-FR-1.2.description: The PSM shall ensure that tax ID number is 9 digits
psm-FR-1.2.source_doc: MISSOURI MEDICAID PROVIDER ENROLLMENT INFORMATION GUIDE.docx

psm-FR-1.3.category: FR 1.  Capability to conduct identity verification
psm-FR-1.3.description: The PSM shall screen providers for managed care plans.
psm-FR-1.3.comment: Is this based on Final Managed Care Rules and 21st Century Cures Act?  Need to check with LA to verify this is the same requirement

psm-FR-1.4.category: FR 1.  Capability to conduct identity verification
psm-FR-1.4.description: The PSM shall have the capability to identify providers by Employer identification number unless the provider is in solo practice or the provider is not in solo practice but billing is by the individual practitioner in which case the PSM shall have the capability to identify providers by social security number.

psm-FR-1.5.category: FR 1.  Capability to conduct identity verification
psm-FR-1.5.description: The PSM shall have the capability to escalate the intensity of screening for providers that are flagged as higher risk.

psm-FR-1.6.category: FR 1.  Capability to conduct identity verification
psm-FR-1.6.description: The PSM shall collect and store standardized W-9 information that reflects the owner of the EIN and the Doing Business As (DBA) name.

psm-FR-2.1.category: FR 2.  Capability to build provider profile
psm-FR-2.1.description: The PSM shall have the option of zipcode + 4 for all address fields

psm-FR-2.2.category: FR 2.  Capability to build provider profile
psm-FR-2.2.description: The PSM shall allow multiple locations for the provider.

psm-FR-2.3.category: FR 2.  Capability to build provider profile
psm-FR-2.3.description: The PSM shall associate multiple Medicare IDs with the same provider, if the provider has multiple locations.
psm-FR-2.3.source_doc: MISSOURI MEDICAID PROVIDER ENROLLMENT INFORMATION GUIDE.docx

psm-FR-2.4.category: FR 2.  Capability to build provider profile
psm-FR-2.4.description: The PSM shall allow applicant to upload attachments to support the application.
psm-FR-2.4.source_doc: MISSOURI MEDICAID PROVIDER ENROLLMENT INFORMATION GUIDE.docx

psm-FR-2.5.category: FR 2.  Capability to build provider profile
psm-FR-2.5.description: The PSM shall indicate what kinds of documents/attachments are required by provider type.
psm-FR-2.5.source_doc: MISSOURI MEDICAID PROVIDER ENROLLMENT INFORMATION GUIDE.docx

psm-FR-2.6.category: FR 2.  Capability to build provider profile
psm-FR-2.6.description: The PSM shall require the following fields: Provider Name, Business Phone, Provider Street Address, City, State, Zip Code, County, SSN, Date of Birth, License Number, IRS Payee Name, DBA Name, Payee Address, Payee City, Payee State, Payee Zip Code, Payee Tax ID, Provider Email address
psm-FR-2.6.source_doc: MISSOURI MEDICAID PROVIDER ENROLLMENT INFORMATION GUIDE.docx
psm-FR-2.6.comment: Will the PSM identify whether the provider is a rendering (eligible to directly bill) or an ordering/referring/prescribing (eligible to enroll but not directly bill state Medicaid agency)?  Not currently plan for PSM functionality

psm-FR-2.7.category: FR 2.  Capability to build provider profile
psm-FR-2.7.description: The PSM shall accept the following fields: Practice Type, Specialties (1 or more), NPI, HIPAA Taxonomy Codes, CLIA number, DHSS certification, Optical and Audiology y/n, Collaborative Practice Agreement y/n, RHC y/n, Medicare Provider Number, Case Mgmt y/n, Rural Health Rate
psm-FR-2.7.source_doc: MISSOURI MEDICAID PROVIDER ENROLLMENT INFORMATION GUIDE.docx

psm-FR-2.8.category: FR 2.  Capability to build provider profile
psm-FR-2.8.description: The PSM shall require the following fields: Contact email, Merger y/n, Owner/board names and addresses, Care settings, DEA controlled substances certification y/n, DEA revocation y/n
psm-FR-2.8.source_doc: MISSOURI MEDICAID PROVIDER ENROLLMENT INFORMATION GUIDE.docx
psm-FR-2.8.comment: Dos this include SSN for owners and others with >5% ownership? Yes!

psm-FR-2.9.category: FR 2.  Capability to build provider profile
psm-FR-2.9.description: The PSM shall accept the following fields: Applicant Name, Contact Person, Contact phone, Medicaid number
psm-FR-2.9.source_doc: MISSOURI MEDICAID PROVIDER ENROLLMENT INFORMATION GUIDE.docx
psm-FR-2.9.comment: To clarify: Applicant is person completing the application, not necessarily provider.  Correct!  Will contact person info differentiate between  contact for billing vs practice locations.  Yes, under Alternative Mailing Addresses.

psm-FR-2.10.category: FR 2.  Capability to build provider profile
psm-FR-2.10.description: The PSM shall notify managed care plans when a provider becomes eligible (has been screened) and/or allow a managed care plan to check a provider's eligibility.

psm-FR-2.11.category: FR 2.  Capability to build provider profile
psm-FR-2.11.description: The PSM shall detect and ask specific questions of bordering-state providers.

psm-FR-2.12.category: FR 2.  Capability to build provider profile
psm-FR-2.12.description: The PSM shall share NPI between individual providers, for group practices.

psm-FR-2.13.category: FR 2.  Capability to build provider profile
psm-FR-2.13.description: The PSM shall limit enrollment to providers in the following categories: (1) in-state, (2) out-of-state in-network, (3) within a defined "border" region of neighboring states.

psm-FR-2.14.category: FR 2.  Capability to build provider profile
psm-FR-2.14.description: The PSM shall use consistent provider naming conventions to differentiate between first names, last names, and business or corporate names and to allow flexible searches based on the provider name.
psm-FR-2.14.comment: Will all individual's names include generation (Jr., III, etc.) Currently we don't have a separate field for generation indication, but could use the last name field.

psm-FR-2.15.category: FR 2.  Capability to build provider profile
psm-FR-2.15.description: The PSM shall maintain a flag for providers who are eligible to use electronic funds transfer (EFT) and electronic claims submission.
psm-FR-2.15.comment: Will PSM allow for provider application fee to be accepted/processed electronically?  Will PSM ask if provider owes state Medicaid agency monies that have not been paid and collect those monies or arrange for repayment at time of enrollment?  No, not currently a PSM function.

psm-FR-2.16.category: FR 2.  Capability to build provider profile
psm-FR-2.16.description: The PSM shall accept, validate, and process transactions or user entries to update and maintain provider information.

psm-FR-2.17.category: FR 2.  Capability to build provider profile
psm-FR-2.17.description: The PSM shall maintain providers’ drug enforcement administration (DEA) numbers.

psm-FR-2.18.category: FR 2.  Capability to build provider profile
psm-FR-2.18.description: The PSM shall have the capability to ensure that providers that have a history of fraud are flagged with a higher risk level at the time of screening

psm-FR-2.19.category: FR 2.  Capability to build provider profile
psm-FR-2.19.description: The PSM shall have the capability to capture critical attributes including licensing information, financial data, and any other data attributes which could impact a risk level.

psm-FR-2.20.category: FR 2.  Capability to build provider profile
psm-FR-2.20.description: The PSM shall collect and maintain licensure information to include at a minimum, licensing state, license number, licensure begin and end dates.

psm-FR-3.1.category: FR 3.  Enable the SMA to provide accurate, streamlined, automated determination of provider eligibility, appeal and revalidation
psm-FR-3.1.description: The PSM shall provide a rejection reason if an application is rejected.

psm-FR-3.2.category: FR 3.  Enable the SMA to provide accurate, streamlined, automated determination of provider eligibility, appeal and revalidation
psm-FR-3.2.description: The PSM shall have the capability to create a high-risk list to ensure that providers that are suspected or known to be fraudulent are flagged at the time of screening.

psm-FR-3.3.category: FR 3.  Enable the SMA to provide accurate, streamlined, automated determination of provider eligibility, appeal and revalidation
psm-FR-3.3.description: The PSM shall flag and route records for action if multiple internal state assigned provider numbers are associated with a single provider.

psm-FR-3.4.category: FR 3.  Enable the SMA to provide accurate, streamlined, automated determination of provider eligibility, appeal and revalidation
psm-FR-3.4.description: The PSM shall separate providers into risk categories limited, moderate, and high based on provider type, as established by CMS.

psm-FR-3.5.category: FR 3.  Enable the SMA to provide accurate, streamlined, automated determination of provider eligibility, appeal and revalidation
psm-FR-3.5.description: The PSM shall screen limited-risk providers by verifying that the provider or supplier meets all applicable federal regulations and state requirements for the provider or supplier type, conducting license verifications, including licensure verifications across state lines for physicians, non-physician practitioners, providers and suppliers, and conducting database checks on a pre-and post-enrollment basis to ensure that providers and suppliers continue to meet the enrollment criteria for their provider/supplier type.

psm-FR-3.6.category: FR 3.  Enable the SMA to provide accurate, streamlined, automated determination of provider eligibility, appeal and revalidation
psm-FR-3.6.description: The PSM shall conduct a fingerprint-based criminal background check for high-risk provider types.
psm-FR-3.6.comment: Will process to conduct FCBC include coordination with state's program that is part of National Background Check Program?  Possible but no specific requirement for this external interface currently.  How will result be communicated to State agency's Fiscal Agent? Unknown at this point.  Will be part of the integration with the other components of MMIS.

psm-FR-3.7.category: FR 3.  Enable the SMA to provide accurate, streamlined, automated determination of provider eligibility, appeal and revalidation
psm-FR-3.7.description: The PSM shall change a provider's risk level due to: imposition of a payment suspension within the previous 10 years; termination from billing Medicaid; exclusion by the OIG; revocation of billing privileges by a Medicare contractor within the previous 10 years (and such provider/supplier is attempting to establish additional Medicare billing privileges by enrolling as a new provider or supplier or establish billing privileges for a new practice location); exclusion from any federal health care program; subject to any final adverse action (as defined in 42 CFR 424.502) within the past 10 years; instances in which CMS lifts a temporary moratorium for a particular provider or supplier type and a provider or supplier that was prevented from enrolling based on the moratorium, applies for enrollment as a Medicare provider or supplier at any time within 6 months from the date the moratorium was lifted.

psm-FR-3.8.category: FR 3.  Enable the SMA to provide accurate, streamlined, automated determination of provider eligibility, appeal and revalidation
psm-FR-3.8.description: The PSM shall compare monitoring statistics (e.g. license expirations that were not caught within a month, total number of sanctions) from one month to the next.

psm-FR-3.9.category: FR 3.  Enable the SMA to provide accurate, streamlined, automated determination of provider eligibility, appeal and revalidation
psm-FR-3.9.description: The PSM shall have the capability to create a learning system to ensure that observed negative trends factor back into  screening rules so as to flag suspicious enrollments early in the screening process, ensuring the ability to detect and reduce/eliminate the incidence of false positives.

psm-FR-3.10.category: FR 3.  Enable the SMA to provide accurate, streamlined, automated determination of provider eligibility, appeal and revalidation
psm-FR-3.10.description: The PSM shall send letter confirming enrollment.
psm-FR-3.10.comment: How will this work if the State Medicaid agency has enrollment requirements outside of what is collected/processed via PSM?  What else is required from WV for the PSM?  It is possible for PSM to use workflow to configure outside enrollment - will need additional requirements.  Otherwise, content of the letter could be configurable to indicate what processes are completed.

psm-FR-3.11.category: FR 3.  Enable the SMA to provide accurate, streamlined, automated determination of provider eligibility, appeal and revalidation
psm-FR-3.11.description: The PSM shall notify providers 90 days before their enrollment expires, so that they can go through revalidation.

psm-FR-3.12.category: FR 3.  Enable the SMA to provide accurate, streamlined, automated determination of provider eligibility, appeal and revalidation
psm-FR-3.12.description: The PSM shall automatically reject applications that do not include all mandatory information.

psm-FR-3.13.category: FR 3.  Enable the SMA to provide accurate, streamlined, automated determination of provider eligibility, appeal and revalidation
psm-FR-3.13.description: The PSM shall have the capability to track and support the screening of applications (and ongoing provider updates) for National Provider Identifier (NPIs), State licenses, Specialty Board certification as appropriate, review team visits when necessary, and any other State and/or Federal Requirement.

psm-FR-3.14.category: FR 3.  Enable the SMA to provide accurate, streamlined, automated determination of provider eligibility, appeal and revalidation
psm-FR-3.14.description: The PSM shall cross-reference license and sanction information with other state or federal agencies.

psm-FR-3.15.category: FR 3.  Enable the SMA to provide accurate, streamlined, automated determination of provider eligibility, appeal and revalidation
psm-FR-3.15.description: The PSM shall have the turnaround time for performing automated checks typical for a web based system

psm-FR-3.16.category: FR 3.  Enable the SMA to provide accurate, streamlined, automated determination of provider eligibility, appeal and revalidation
psm-FR-3.16.description: The PSM shall provide comprehensive verification of all (verifiable) data fields for all providers enrolled

psm-FR-3.17.category: FR 3.  Enable the SMA to provide accurate, streamlined, automated determination of provider eligibility, appeal and revalidation
psm-FR-3.17.description: The PSM shall improve efficiency of the Screening Solution in terms of cost and schedule to actually implement

psm-FR-3.18.category: FR 3.  Enable the SMA to provide accurate, streamlined, automated determination of provider eligibility, appeal and revalidation
psm-FR-3.18.description: The PSM shall Improve effectiveness of the risk-screening model in detecting fraud based issues

psm-FR-3.19.category: FR 3.  Enable the SMA to provide accurate, streamlined, automated determination of provider eligibility, appeal and revalidation
psm-FR-3.19.description: The PSM shall Improve technical soundness of risk-scoring in flagging potential fraudulent patterns and tendencies

psm-FR-3.20.category: FR 3.  Enable the SMA to provide accurate, streamlined, automated determination of provider eligibility, appeal and revalidation
psm-FR-3.20.description: The PSM shall define a common workflow for collecting enrollment information of individual providers

psm-FR-3.21.category: FR 3.  Enable the SMA to provide accurate, streamlined, automated determination of provider eligibility, appeal and revalidation
psm-FR-3.21.description: The PSM shall save administrative/infrastructure cost by providing a multi-tenant provider screening solution

psm-FR-3.22.category: FR 3.  Enable the SMA to provide accurate, streamlined, automated determination of provider eligibility, appeal and revalidation
psm-FR-3.22.description: The PSM shall reduce the time needed by providers to submit new/renewal application information and resolve discrepancies.

psm-FR-3.23.category: FR 3.  Enable the SMA to provide accurate, streamlined, automated determination of provider eligibility, appeal and revalidation
psm-FR-3.23.description: The PSM shall reduce processing and transaction time for submitting and receiving queries to authoritative data sources regarding provider credentials and sanctions.

psm-FR-3.24.category: FR 3.  Enable the SMA to provide accurate, streamlined, automated determination of provider eligibility, appeal and revalidation
psm-FR-3.24.description: The PSM shall validate, and/or verify that all data items that contain self-checking digits (e.g., National Provider Identifier) passes a specified check-digit test.

psm-FR-3.25.category: FR 3.  Enable the SMA to provide accurate, streamlined, automated determination of provider eligibility, appeal and revalidation
psm-FR-3.25.description: The PSM shall allow state reviewers to assign and queue applications.

psm-FR-4.1.description: The PSM shall show a list of settings in which a provider might see clients/patients, including "Other."
psm-FR-4.1.source_doc: MISSOURI MEDICAID PROVIDER ENROLLMENT INFORMATION GUIDE.docx

psm-FR-4.2.description: The PSM shall allow applicants to choose multiple care settings.
psm-FR-4.2.source_doc: MISSOURI MEDICAID PROVIDER ENROLLMENT INFORMATION GUIDE.docx

psm-FR-4.3.description: The PSM shall allow providers to update information and initiate re-screening process (e.g., in the following situations: name change, change of ownership/operator - whether or not it is the same practice location, address change, Federal Tax Identification Number change at same practice location, change from Social Security Number to Federal Tax Identification Number at same practice location, change from Federal Tax Identification Number to Social Security Number at same practice location, payment name or address change, and additional service location)
psm-FR-4.3.source_doc: MISSOURI MEDICAID PROVIDER ENROLLMENT INFORMATION GUIDE.docx

psm-FR-4.4.description: The PSM shall provide space for results of on-site visits, for moderate- and high-risk provider types.

psm-FR-4.5.description: The PSM shall support the Extract, Transform and Load (ETL) processes from real-time  web services or batch processes.

psm-FR-4.6.description: The PSM shall have the ability to enforce limits on the number of providers of a given type enrolled simultaneously.

psm-FR-4.7.description: The PSM shall support admin-configurable automated re-screening.  C.f. psm-FR-7.3.

psm-FR-4.8.description: The PSM shall support provider agents (a.k.a. service agents a.k.a. non-provider users) who act on a provider's behalf and whose authorization may be a subset of that provider's.

psm-FR-5.1.description: The PSM shall issue Medicaid provider ID number to each approved provider.
psm-FR-5.1.comment: Medicaid provider ID aka Atypical Provider Identifier (API).  Could be part of the help tip to include API.  If necessary, could change the Medicaid provider ID text field by adding  the following: (or Atypical Provider Identifier).

psm-FR-5.2.description: The PSM shall allow providers to terminate their enrollment on a specified date.
psm-FR-5.2.comment: PSM should capture a termination reason code.  Need a list of termination reason code from WV. Have requirement for termination screen but not implemented yet in PSM.

psm-FR-5.3.description: The PSM shall require providers to give 30 days notice before terminating enrollment.

psm-FR-5.4.description: The PSM shall require PC Plus providers to give 90 days notice before terminating enrollment.

psm-FR-5.5.description: The PSM shall maintain the capability to limit billing and providers to certain benefit plans, services, by procedure codes, ranges of procedure codes, member age or by provider type(s) or as otherwise directed by the State.

psm-FR-5.6.description: The PSM shall require revalidation period to be configurable.

psm-FR-5.7.description: PSM shall terminate enrollment if revalidation is not completed.

psm-FR-5.8.description: The PSM shall capture a termination reason code that is provided by the State

psm-FR-6.1.description: The PSM shall download all monitoring risk scores for each month as a CSV

psm-FR-6.2.description: The PSM shall maintain date-specific provider enrollment and demographic data.

psm-FR-6.3.description: The PSM shall maintain an audit trail of all updates to the provider data, for a time period specified by the state.

psm-FR-6.4.description: The PSM shall remember previous rejected providers and reasons for rejection corresponding form fields

psm-FR-6.5.description: The PSM shall, to extent permitted by law, make screening data available for analytics and other reporting purposes.
psm-FR-6.5.comment: Does this include development of and tech support for common enrollment reports? Tech support for ad hoc reports?  Tech support report will be provided separately and not part of PSM.  Currently no reporting against database with PSM, this would be a separate requirement for ad-hoc report generation.  Question for WV:  what reports are you interested in?

psm-FR-6.6.description: The PSM shall keep a record of the date of each screening/monitoring event, the score, and the agencies decision for each provider.

psm-FR-6.7.description: The PSM shall store monthly audit record for a provider even if their information has not changed.

psm-FR-6.8.description: The PSM shall provide an input to document the nature for the type of screening/monitoring event, the score, and the agencies decision for each provider.

psm-FR-7.1.description: The PSM shall provide per-field instructions on the application screen.
psm-FR-7.1.source_doc: MISSOURI MEDICAID PROVIDER ENROLLMENT INFORMATION GUIDE.docx

psm-FR-7.2.description: The PSM shall provide detailed instructions for completing the application via a Help link.
psm-FR-7.2.source_doc: MISSOURI MEDICAID PROVIDER ENROLLMENT INFORMATION GUIDE.docx

psm-FR-7.3.description: The PSM shall not send re-screening results to admin for review if provider information has not changed.

psm-FR-7.4.description: The PSM shall provide a screen to verify entered information.
psm-FR-7.4.source_doc: MISSOURI MEDICAID PROVIDER ENROLLMENT INFORMATION GUIDE.docx

psm-FR-7.5.description: The PSM shall allow applicant to edit entered information.
psm-FR-7.5.source_doc: MISSOURI MEDICAID PROVIDER ENROLLMENT INFORMATION GUIDE.docx

psm-FR-7.6.description: The PSM shall allow applicant to print application for their records.
psm-FR-7.6.source_doc: MISSOURI MEDICAID PROVIDER ENROLLMENT INFORMATION GUIDE.docx

psm-FR-7.7.description: The PSM shall allow applicant to save a partial application as a draft.
psm-FR-7.7.source_doc: MISSOURI MEDICAID PROVIDER ENROLLMENT INFORMATION GUIDE.docx

psm-FR-7.8.description: The PSM shall indicate which fields are required.
psm-FR-7.8.source_doc: MISSOURI MEDICAID PROVIDER ENROLLMENT INFORMATION GUIDE.docx

psm-FR-7.9.description: The PSM shall prevent application submission if required fields are empty.
psm-FR-7.9.source_doc: MISSOURI MEDICAID PROVIDER ENROLLMENT INFORMATION GUIDE.docx

psm-FR-7.10.description: The PSM shall show integrated history of a provider record -- allow users to scroll back in history to see changes over time without needing to navigate to separate files.

psm-FR-7.11.description: The PSM shall validate entered information as provider fills out application (not at the end of the process).

psm-FR-7.12.description: The PSM shall provide a configurable time frame for a "stale" enrollment draft application.

psm-FR-7.13.description: The PSM shall support searching and pattern-matching based on all fields accepted as input (and based on all reasonable combinations of such fields).

psm-FR-7.14.description: The PSM's user interface shall be as simple, comprehensible, navigable, reliable, robust in the face of error, and responsive as possible.

psm-FR-7.15.description: The PSM shall provide instructions for using the application as an administrator via a help link or similar feature.

psm-FR-8.1.description: The PSM shall support communications to and from providers and track and monitor responses to the communications.

psm-FR-8.2.description: The PSM shall generate information requests, correspondence, or notifications based on the status of the application for enrollment.

psm-FR-8.3.description: The PSM shall support automated criminal background checks for all providers as specified by the State.

psm-FR-8.4.description: The PSM shall produce notices to applicants of pending status, approval, or rejection of their applications.

psm-FR-8.5.description: The PSM shall add a attestation, using configurable link or text, to the reading and understanding of the required state Medicaid agency materials prior to enrollment.

psm-FR-9.1.description: The PSM shall integrate provider-type business rules described in the Enrollment Information Guide into the system.
psm-FR-9.1.source_doc: MISSOURI MEDICAID PROVIDER ENROLLMENT INFORMATION GUIDE.docx

psm-FR-9.2.description: The PSM shall integrate records with MO HealthNet.
psm-FR-9.2.source_doc: MISSOURI MEDICAID PROVIDER ENROLLMENT INFORMATION GUIDE.docx

psm-FR-9.3.description: The PSM shall support a provider appeals process in compliance with federal guidelines (42 CFR 431.105)

psm-FR-9.4.description: The PSM shall verify provider eligibility in support of other system processes, i.e. payment of claims.

psm-FR-9.5.description: The PSM shall ensure proprietary interfaces and protocols between modules are not used.

psm-FR-10.1.description: The PSM shall validate HIPAA Taxonomy codes against http://www.wpc-edi.com/codes/taxonomy
psm-FR-10.1.source_doc: MISSOURI MEDICAID PROVIDER ENROLLMENT INFORMATION GUIDE.docx

psm-FR-10.2.description: The PSM shall be accessible in compliance with Section 508 of the Rehabilitation Act.

psm-PH-1.1.category: PH 1.  CSF PH2: Provider claims are adjudicated accurately within established time parameters.
psm-PH-1.1.description: The PSM shall verify that required data items are present and retained (See SMM 11375) including all data needed for State or Federal reporting requirements.

psm-PH-1.2.category: PH 1.  CSF PH2: Provider claims are adjudicated accurately within established time parameters.
psm-PH-1.2.description: The PSM shall check Provider Screening Applications to ensure that all required attachments, per the reference records or edits, have been received and maintained for audit purposes or have been submitted prior to the Provider Screening Applications and a prior authorization has been established.

psm-PH-1.3.category: PH 1.  CSF PH2: Provider claims are adjudicated accurately within established time parameters.
psm-PH-1.3.description: The PSM shall verify that all data necessary for legal requirements are retained.

psm-PH-1.4.category: PH 1.  CSF PH2: Provider claims are adjudicated accurately within established time parameters.
psm-PH-1.4.description: The PSM shall verify that all dates are valid and reasonable.

psm-SC-1.1.description: The PSM shall accommodate customer preferences for communications by email, text, mobile devices, or phones.

psm-SC-2.1.description: The PSM shall comply with standards and protocols adopted by the Secretary under sections 1104 and 1561 of the Affordable Care Act.
psm-SC-2.1.comment: N/A - 1104 and 1561 are for individuals and not providers

psm-SC-3.1.description: The PSM shall support the architecture adopted to preserve the ability to efficiently, effectively, and appropriately exchange data with other participants in the health and human services enterprise.

psm-SC-4.0.description: The PSM shall use regionally standardized business rule definitions in both human and machine-readable formats.
psm-SC-4.0.comment: No in the pre-cert check list but PSM will do this

psm-SC-4.1.description: The PSM shall contain modules that can be interchanged without major system design.
psm-SC-4.1.comment: Evidence: have an architecture diagram showing rules engine is an separate component

psm-SC-4.2.description: The PSM shall use an intrastate rules engine separate from core programming with established interstate standardized business rules definitions.
psm-SC-4.2.comment: Evidence: have an architecture diagram showing rules engine is an separate component

psm-SC-4.3.description: The PSM design documents shall utilize a widely supported modeling language (e.g., UML, BPMN).

psm-SC-4.4.description: The PSM shall support open standards between key interfaces have been considered for all and chosen where feasible.

psm-SC-4.5.description: The PSM shall support Modularity verification through extensive testing that demonstrates compliance with  chosen interface standards and specifications.

863.title: Rejecting an application fails
863.description:
I believe this is a consequence of the changes in #839, which I didn't catch in my review -- sorry, @frankduncan.  

When @slifty set up rejection notifications in PR #750, he added a new `getUserByEnrollment` method, which operated under the assumption that the enrollment user would be a string (I think).  It looks to me like @frankduncan's changes in response to my request in #815 mean that the enrollment is now (properly!) linked to a user, not just the user_id string.  This broke Dan's earlier method, meaning that we can't send rejection notifications.

As ever, this just goes to show that we need more complete test coverage.  It shouldn't be too bad to fix this particular problem, though.

862.title: Standardize on 'Low' vs 'Limited' risk level
862.description: Currently the tables under Enrollments use "Low" as a risk level, while the "Risk Levels" report uses "Limited" rather than "Low".  "Limited" is used in the source code.  Decide which term to use in the UI and use it everywhere for consistency.  (PRs #838 and #858 add the "Risk Levels" report.)

854.title: Show remittance sequence in jsp using enum values rather than static text
854.description:
As part of #167 proper way to keep this label to key value in sync was implemented. However the flaw exists in UI and other places where a static text is rendered using a if..then clause. 

Going forward all the jsp's will use this enum object to translate the key to label/description accordingly.

851.title: Add debug mode
851.description:
There are some features that would be helpful to have for debugging, but which production deployments should not have. Some examples:

- Show the full stack trace of an exception in debug mode, and a generic error in prod mode (#831)
- Show the source JSP file names in the rendered HTML in debug mode, but not in prod mode (#557)
- Bundle the `axe-core` JavaScript into the app in debug mode, but not in prod mode (#648) (maybe? maybe this should be in prod mode, too, so that we can do accessibility tests against the "real thing"!)
- (please edit this comment to add more as we discover or think of them!)

This might be a flag in `cms.properties`, or it might be an alternate build (`./gradlew cms-portal-services:debugBuild`, for example?), or it might be an environment variable, or a setting in the application server, or it might be something else entirely.

850.title: Revise Design Document
850.description: Design document needs to be updated with current modules and its purpose and how they play a role in the application.

847.title: Add authn/authz to FHIR API
847.description:
I'm splitting this out from #623 so we can more easily track it.

Currently, the API is completely public.  For the first round of controlling who calls the API, we'll have three kinds of access:
- [ ] no access at all -- this is a user who has no right to read or write to the API
- [ ] read-only access to all information accessible via the API
- [ ] read and write access to all information accessible via the API

Note that currently the API only has `GET` endpoints, so there is nowhere for a user to write to.

@slifty, @notpace, @kfogel, and I have begun to have some conversations about future, more complicated, authorization strategies.  These are somewhat related to the user role conversation in #10.

We expect that we will want some kind of business-limited access, where a provider has access to read and write to resources that they "own."  This "ownership" right now would be determined (probably?) by the creator of the resource.  That is, if a provider created an application for enrollment then they'd be considered its owner and would be able to view and edit that application via the API (once the API is sophisticated enough to allow that).  Other modules in the MMIS, meanwhile, should have access to all resources, regardless of owner.

846.title: Add new fields to FHIR API
846.description:
I'm splitting this out from #623 to allow us to more easily track our progress.

These new fields will be added as `input` elements on the FHIR Task resource:

- [ ] EFT acceptance indicator
- [ ] provider date of birth
- [ ] telecom
- [ ] address

Tagging @slifty @mbestavros @notpace.

842.title: Show error on personal email address
842.description:
As of PR #832, the contact email address will be required (which is a consequence of #341, which uses that email address to send notifications to users).  For individual enrollment applications, the contact email is sometimes autofilled from the "Email Address" input by using the "Same as Above" checkbox.  That "Email Address" field is *not* required in and of itself.

@frankduncan noticed that if a user fills in information, leaving the Email Address input empty (allowed) and checking the "Same as Above" checkbox, the ensuing error is unclear.  The "Same as Above" checkbox means that the Email Address is suddenly required, because it fills the Contact Email field, which is required.  I hope this is comprehensible.

I thought that the thing to do was to add an error to the new Contact Email rule which would change the error text if the "Same as Above" checkbox was checked, so that the red highlighting would appear around the "Email Address" field and the error text would read "Email Address is required when Same as Above is checked."  While doing that, I found that the rules currently don't appear to have any concept of the Email Address field at all, meaning that adding an error reporter on that field has no effect.

I believe that the way to add this element to the rules is by adding it to the "PersonalInformation" fieldset, which appears to be generated from the JAXB "PersonType".  I don't know how to alter these JAXB objects, though.

It would be simpler to do this in Javascript, but I *would* like to be consistent in how we create error messages for users, so the right thing seems to be to handle this in the rules.

833.title: Missing contact info on switching provider types
833.description:
I am able to provoke a null pointer exception if I submit an organization enrollment application after beginning the application as an individual provider:

1. Start new enrollment application
2. Choose "Acupuncturist" as provider type
3. Fill in Personal Info page, checking the "Same as above" checkbox in the contact info area
4. Click "Next" to go to the License Info page
5. Click "Previous" to go to the Personal Info page
6. Click "Previous" to go to the Select Provider Type page
7. Select "Pharmacy" as provider type
8. Fill out the rest of the enrollment application with valid data as usual
9. Submit application
